- Location: Facade, Intercolumnar C  
- Date: Uncertain, probably Nero (cf. [Esna 91])

<div class="col2">  
  
*spr m ḥtp r ḥw.t-Mw.t  *  
  *n mw.t=f wr.t-ḥkȝw  *  
    *ḫw=s ḥʿw=k  *  
    *rn=k nḫb(.w)   *  
      *m nỉw.wt spȝ.wt  *  
    
*štȝ.t wr.t  *  
*ỉr=s mk.t=k  *  
*sḫr=s sbỉ  *  
  *r bw ẖr ḥm=k  *  
    
*šzp.tw=k Mnṯw  *  
*ẖnm.tw=k Itm m ḥtp*  
   *ỉw ỉb=k nḏm(.w)  *    
  
Arrive in peace to the Temple of the Mother,[^fn-090-0]    
 of your mother, Weret-hekau,    
   she protects your body,  
   and your name is inscribed[^fn-090-1]    
     in (all) cities and nomes.   
   
The great, mysterious one:  
she performs your protections,  
she knocks downs the rebel   
   wherever your majesty might be.    
  
Montu receives you,    
Atum embraces you in peace,   
   your heart is pleased.    
  
  
</div>  
  
[^fn-090-0]: This text runs over [Esna 91], where Montu and Atum introduce Nero before Neith and Heka the child.  
  
[^fn-090-1]: ![](images/090_1.png){width=8%}: @sayed-neith, p. 633 translated: "ton nom est «celui de lotus»", but this is more likely the verb *nḫb*, "to inscribe", regularly determined with the lotus (*Wb* II, 307, 15).
